betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Phials you've used before, but what you didn't realize (and, until your completion of the Alchemical Furnace, couldn't really test) is that they are capable of holding Essentia.

Phials can only hold §oexactly§r eight of a single type of Essentia, since otherwise it would experience conditions allowing it to turn into Flux. You can right click a source of safely contained Essentia - as in an Alembic or Warded Jar, but not a Crucible - to fill a Phial, or right click to empty the Phial's content into a Warded Jar (or similar).

Phials can generally be reused, including for moving around Essentia or crafting labels already filtered for a specific Essentia type. They will be consumed in certain crafting processes, such as the one described in the quest following this one.

Despite showing no aspects when scanned filled Phials do contain the amount of Essentia listed on their tooltip, so they can be I.E. thrown into a crucible... though why you'd want to do that at this stage is beyond me.
